result.execSummary:
Rashod D Morris was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Rashod D Morris was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rashod D Morris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rashod D Morris not in court.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defendant has been extradited.
State moves to dismiss.
BTC:  Dismiss.
Review hearing on May 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rashod D Morris in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Rashond D Morris in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
State of Indiana req extradition.
Defendant does not contest.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.
BTC:  Amend defendant's name to Rashod D. Morris.  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.

Defendant Rashond D Morris in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Rashond D Morris in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
  Review hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
